column4: it's more than just that... i've been frakkin with this for about 4 days now, over several 6am nights.
permissions, mount locations, various config entries.
you see, it's a largeish drive and it will be my torrent dump. and i own porn sites. and i have teenage sons. and i have a wife that's quite good with guns.
so i need it to be lockedish

[00:24:03]  <chip> Running newest kubuntu (7.04?) and trying to set up Samba for the home network. Have a 2ndary drive in a 2ndary machine that i want to serve to my main destop and the wifes laptop. it always askes me to either login from the windows machine or won't allow entry to the dir from the windows machine.
[00:24:25]  <chip> even tho it's kde, i'm not afraid of cli action
is your username and password the same under Samba and Windows?
have you checked /var/log/samba/log.smbd immediately following a failed login attempt?
the last entry is the last time i restarted samba
strange... so, to be sure, it prompts you for a password but then never lets you in? what error message does Windows give you?
what error message do you receive? also, try accessing via IP address - \\192.168.whatever
have you tried accessing via IP address \\192.168.whatever? I find it strange that log.smbd is empty.
